docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Aug. 16 (UP) -- Argentine President Juan D. Peron handed back to Paraguay today the military trophies taken from this country in the war of 1865-70.
docs.lead_paragraph: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Aug. 16 (UP) -- Argentine President Juan D. Peron handed back to Paraguay today the military trophies taken from this country in the war of 1865-70.

headline.main: PERON GIVES BACK PARAGUAY'S FLAGS; Military Trophies Captured in the War of 1865-70 by the Triple Alliance

docs.snippet: Aggregate draft indebtedness of Latin-American countries to United States exporters continued to increase in July, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Aggregate draft indebtedness of Latin-American countries to United States exporters continued to increase in July, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.
docs.abstract: NY Fed Reserve Bank repts draft debt to US exporters up $5.5 million to $125.9 million, July; other data

headline.main: LATIN DRAFT DEBT CONTINUES TO RISE; Trade Credit Up $5,500,000 in July to 8-Month High -- Brazil Leads Advance

docs.snippet: EVANSTON, Ill., Aug. 20 -- A Protestant minister from the Soviet Zone of Germany told the World Council of Churches here today that the gulf between Communism and Christianity "cannot be bridged."
docs.lead_paragraph: EVANSTON, Ill., Aug. 20 -- A Protestant minister from the Soviet Zone of Germany told the World Council of Churches here today that the gulf between Communism and Christianity "cannot be bridged."

headline.main: RED ZONE PASTOR CALLS 'GULF' DEEP; Tells World Council Nothing Can Heal the Rift Between Christianity, Communism

docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges moved irregularly last week. Turnover was not particularly heavy but at times special situations acted to speed up the pace of the market and an increase in transfers.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 23 -- By cooperation the United States can save at least five years in the development of commercial atomic power in South America with actual benefit to the United States' own atomic program, Robert LeBaron, who is intimately...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 23 -- By cooperation the United States can save at least five years in the development of commercial atomic power in South America with actual benefit to the United States' own atomic program, Robert LeBaron, who is intimately associated with that program, said here today.
docs.abstract: R LeBaron sees commercial power development advanced 5 yrs, S Amer, if US helps; discusses potential

headline.main: U. S. ATOMIC HELP TO LATINS URGED; Five Years Can Be Saved by Supplying of Parts, LeBaron Says in Rio

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: EVANSTON, Ill., Aug. 24 -- The scheduled election of six new presidents of the World Council of Churches was unexpectedly delayed for twenty-four hours tonight on a motion put before the General Assembly by Pastor Martin Niemoeller of Germany. The...
docs.lead_paragraph: EVANSTON, Ill., Aug. 24 -- The scheduled election of six new presidents of the World Council of Churches was unexpectedly delayed for twenty-four hours tonight on a motion put before the General Assembly by Pastor Martin Niemoeller of Germany. The vote was 158 for postponement to 146 against.
docs.abstract: assembly approves Pastor Niemoeller motion to delay vote to weigh nominating layman; other sessions

headline.main: ELECTION DELAYED BY CHURCH COUNCIL; Naming of 6 New Presidents Put Off 24-Hours to Restudy the Slate of Nominees

docs.snippet: EVANSTON, Ill., Aug. 25 -- After a delay of twenty-four hours, six clergymen who had been nominated as presidents of the World Council of Churches were elected here tonight.
docs.lead_paragraph: EVANSTON, Ill., Aug. 25 -- After a delay of twenty-four hours, six clergymen who had been nominated as presidents of the World Council of Churches were elected here tonight.

headline.main: CHURCH COUNCIL PICKS PRESIDIUM; Original Slate Elected After Days' Delay Over Motion of Pastor Niemoeller
